text: Check if object is file-like in Python
File-like objects are objects in Python that behave like a real file, e.g.
have a read() and a write method(), but have a different implementation.
It is and realization of the Duck Typing concept.
It is considered good practice to allow a file-like object everywhere where a file is expected so that e.g.
a StringIO or a Socket object can be used instead a real file.
So it is bad to perform a check like this:

code:
if not isinstance(fp, file):
   raise something

text: What is the best way to check if an object (e.g.
a parameter of a method) is "file-like"?
